caption: Table 1: Different types of inference from a variational perspective, including a proper “planning
description: This table summarizes different types of probabilistic inference from a variational perspective.  It shows the closed-form expression for the quantity of interest for each inference type (marginal, planning, marginal MAP, MAP, marginal), the corresponding entropy term in the variational bound, and whether a closed-form solution exists for Markov Decision Processes (MDPs).  The table highlights that the different inference types correspond to different weightings of the entropy terms, and that planning can be seen as a specific type of inference with a particular entropy weighting.
